message.body: hey. sorry i didn't reply sooner, i was taking the world's most intense nap.
but of course! I would expect no less from the world's most intense girl. also I just woke up from the second-most-intense nap
we're kind of doing the whole napping thing wrong. i don't think they're supposed to end so late at night.
you're right. we can't keep running to bed to hide from our unaptitudes
I'm going to enroll us both in a remedial napping class. it's for the best
i'm hoping to convert my remedial biology class into a remedial napping class. you're welcome to join.
that sounds grand. I shall join you in this class. can we be study buddies??
i like the multiple questions marks to indicate enthusiasm, haha. but yes.
prospective study buddy status: [ ] not enthusiastic [X] enthusiastic
that's the spirit!!!!!!!! (excessive enthusiasm does not come naturally to me at this hour)
it's ok, the 500 exclamation marks were convincing. omg guess what
idk, tell me.
that was a pretty bad guess. I'll just tell you. I left work at 4 today and looked at THREE different apartment complexes before 6 (which is when they al
l close). how impressed are you now?
very impressed, particularly with the fact that you must not have gotten that lost.
thank you. I am so great at using iPhone maps. actually one of the places I made up my mind as soon as I got there..
made up your mind in a positive way or in any OH-GOD-NO way?
the latter, unfortunately. I drove by construction and dirt mountains for a good 30 seconds before I ever saw the actual buildings where humans lived. no
gates, and the only parking I saw was parallel in the roads around the buildings
yeah, that's not, like, ideal.
my thoughts exactly. but this other place was literally perfect and I'm not sure if I should fill out an app now or what (pay $45 but secure a room+price)
oh, that's awesome. what would be holding you back?
I mean I wanted to go over it with my mom but then my nap happened. and I had some more places on my radar which I hadn't checked yet... but like even $4
5 isn't a huge amount if I changed my mind ya know
ok what do you think about carpet vs hardwood
not that my opinion is super relevant, but i don't really have a preference either way. hard wood is easier to clean and generally looks nicer over time, i guess.
of course it's relevant I don't know things ugh
the only downside to hard wood is that it's (usually) more expensive. and if you're one of those old ladies whose afraid of draughts then maybe that would be problematic.
I don't think I'm an old lady. and the place I liked best only had carpets but the place I liked second-best had hardwood
and I'm afraid I only liked that one place better because the agent was cooler
hahaha, wow, first world probs. :)
ikr but really the second guy seemed so jaded and bored with his life. I had to ask for every detail and sometimes he'd just be like "uhh I don't live he
re so I'm not really sure..."
stoner-realtor?
might have been.
WHAT WHY IS THAT EVEN A THING THAT YOU OWN
that is so ridiculous yet appropriate. I bow to you
i buy my mugs from thrift stores (because i've got true class). and thanks!
omg i just found an about.com article with 200 punny shop names. looking for competition for lettuce souprise you.
I love that that one caught your eye haha. and OMG WHAT link me this pronto
grammar.about.com/od/words/a/punnamestores.htm
"c'est cheese" is my favorite so far.
"sofa so good"
omg. "beddie buyz" <--- the fact that it's in London makes it even better
uk-ers appear to be very punny people.
hahahahaha "frying nemo"
LETTUCE SOUPRISE YOU IS ON THE LIST
LOL Julius Cedar (lumberyard in Canada)
OMGGGGGG<3
marquis de salade
brewed awakening for a coffee shop is genius
CUSTARDS LAST STAND LOL
i liked that one too! plus its cousin mustard's last stand.
Fish-cotheque (fish and chips shop in London) omg new favorite.
wholly crepe might be mine.
hahahahaha Chinese restaurant "men at wok" I even read it in a Chinese accent!!
hahaha yes! also i see that the weiner circle (chicago) is on there. it's a famous enough place that i've heard of it for other reasons, even.
pizza my heart! I ate there when I was in CA for one of my interviews!
totally turning this list into a bucket list. no but seriously though have you ever seen/read anything about the weiner circle!
I have not :(
wow I'm reading the wiki page this place is legit famous
kk i'm gonna fb you a link from the this american life tv show about it because it's so interesting
ok!
omg guess what yo
more apartment news?
nope
what, then?
at work we have something once a quarter called a hackday which means you get a day to work on any project you want
and it's tomorrow. and on Monday you can present your idea to the CEO CTO etc (all the important people) and it's like a competition
if they choose your idea, you get a 6 week period to work on JUST that idea, and you also get $10,000
and I'm entering this time :) I got one of the best guys on my team to work with me on my idea, and you're supposed to have a business person on your tea
m too and I think our project director is gonna do it (also really smart)
cool! so what's your idea?
hmm basically an improvement to our job recommendation emails where recipients can indicate whether certain skill descriptions (which our system automati
cally recognizes by scanning their résumé) are a good match for them or not
so if you got an email with suggestions of jobs "language scientist" and "pro wrestler" you could give a higher weight to the Linguistics skill and a low
er weight to Wrestling
that's cool! except i'm an awesome wrestler also. (not really)
too late. you issued an implicit challenge. now we must wrestle to the death.
... i would die. do you want to be responsible for my death?
...ok. maybe not to the death. didn't think of that.
ahhh so cuuute
I NO U R BUT WUT AM I
well hello there. how was your day :)
busy, but good! how was yours?
pretty good. also busy -- I was at work almost 10 hours today, but almost all of that was hackday stuff
aah, how'd it go?!
IT WAS COOL. the guy I got to work with me is really smart. I mean he's on my team but I've never really worked a project with him before -- we came up w
ith so many good improvements
that's awesome! so did you present it today too?
oh hellz no. we are not nearly ready for that. presentations are on Monday which is still uncomfortably close.
esp given that he works from home on Fridays so tomorrow is our only rehearsing day
oh man. pressure's on!
force divided by area is on?
i feel like maybe we've had this conversation before.
omg yes that happens to me too. so embarrassing.
can we make a pact to not make fun of each other when we do that
i would never make fun of you for that!
oh.. yeah, I mean.. neither would I! I was just testing you.
oh, but you can make fun of me for whatever you like, no worries!
YOUR INITIALS ARE LK EVEN THOUGH K COMES BEFORE L IN THE ALPHABET THAT'S BACKWARDS DONT YOU KNOW THE ALPHABET, LINGUISTICS GIRL???
hahaha i transposed j & k in the alphabet until i was like 10... so, going on precedent... no.
well then. don't I look like an ass now.
it's cool, i'm like fully literate now or whatever, i'm pretty sure. either that or i've just got the world's best autocorrect.
no way, I do. I actually just type ke$ha lyrics and it turns into my intended message
hey, don't be hating on ke$ha! that girl is pretty clever to have everyone fooled the way she does.
I'm not hating! I think she's great
actually I probably know more ke$ha lyrics than nicki minaj. or about an equal amount
they're both pretty fascinating people.
you're pretty fascinating people.
glad i've got someone fooled! :)
fool me once, shame on you. fool me twice, shame on you twice
#noshame #sorrynotsorry
but yes, I am thoroughly hornswoggled.
look at you with your fancy words! must be all that book-learnin'.
I eat books for breakfast :o
i know there are puns here... it's just past the hour when i can reliably come up with any...
that's what SHE said.
ummm. it is, in fact, what i said.
I am full of facts. also I didn't even realize the pun potential, so you're doing better than me :)
but not by much since i still haven't got any.
close races are more fun!
I've gotten ~6 hours of sleep every night this week. convince me to go to bed early.
it's what all the cool kids are doing. and by "all the cool kids", i mean "me".
good point. you are all the cool kids I need in life.
if you use my translation system that makes less sense. but! i appreciate the sentiment.

...would that translate to "you are all the me I need" or "you are all the you I need"?
sentiment is almost the same as sediment.

"you are all the you i need." pronouns swap because the referent isn't changing.
...and no, it's not...
you are SO DIFFICULT
it's the only purpose in life i'm sure of. :)
well I like challenges, so there
i'll be sure to be EXTRA difficult, then. take that!
pssh. I can handle you and your feminine wiles!
we'll see. :)
i really should get to bed, though. (as should you.)
that requires movement. I am a sloth. mmmmffghgh
but yes ok yes ok yes you're right. bedtime. goodnight sleep tight sweet dreamz.
nighty night!
hahaha this is my favorite thing ever
whyyy
I had trail mix for hackday yesterday and I hate raisins but I didn't want to waste them
fact about you: no raisins.
Thomas M###### Facts - blond hair - blue eyes - software engineer - no raisins
basically. gotta keep you separate from all the other blond, blue-eyed software engineers somehow.
yep. it is my one distinguishing trait. what's yours?
lauren krucke facts -tall -brown hair -studio tech -mildly face-blind
yep... I'd say that's a pretty unambiguous identifier for you. I read the wiki page btw for prosopagnosia (did I get it right?) and I showed my mom and s
he was so fascinated by it. have you had it since birth?

"and i showed my mom" --you're adorable. and yeah. no one ever questioned why i never remembered my parents' friends (or any non-immediate family, for that matter), but in retrospect the face thing is probably to blame.
eh. she gets to see my favorites. :)
I have a very important inquiry for you
what is it?

are you free this weekend
this is very important because there is a surprise bonus question based on your response
choose wisely grasshopper
depends on the day...
well as of now I have no other plans. you get first dibs on my weekend :*)
i work fridays from 4-7, but i guess other than that i'm free.
haha, I rarely leave work before 7. except today I left early to look at apartments which turned out to be disappointing. anyway, how's dinner+movie on S
aturday sound?
that sounds good. so the apartment search is proving a let down?
well I've now visited seven places and actually toured five of them. the only two I really was considering were Lenox Hills and AMLI at North Briarcliff-
-Lenox was my fave but I realized it's in kind of a crappy area; AMLI I just had a lame leasing agent showing me around so it tainted my experience :(
aw, that's no good. so now what?
I'm thinking I might go look at AMLI again or dig deeper into my list of potential apartments (the guy at Promove found like 100 and just talked to me ab
out the top few; I'm not out of candidates or anything)
so you're not too disheartened, then. that's good.
no way. I will find a place if it's the last thing I do :)
determination! i like it!
it likes you! (but it also likes covered parking, gated complexes, decent fitness centers, and W/D connections)
picky picky determination! haha.
only the greatest castle in the land for king Thomas.
hahaha. good.
do you have any preference on movie choice for saturday? also FYI I'm not actually a king that part was just for jokes
not a big fan of horror or dumb comedy. other than that i don't care.
I have never enjoyed horror movies. high five.
